member.summary: This is reserved for the NullToken.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.TokenType.Identifier
member.summary: An identifier can be either a class or property name. The tokenizer does not have enough information to make that distinction.

member.summary: An operator like + or *.

member.summary: A comma

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.TokenType.Dot
member.summary: A dot (".").

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.TokenType.Primitive
member.summary: A primitive like a quoted string, boolean value, or number.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Parser
member.summary: Parses expressions written in strings into CodeDom expressions. There is a certain amount of context that the parser may need to be familiar with. This is why the parsing methods are not exposed as static.

member.summary: Recursive method that reads an expression.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Parser.ReadIdentifier(Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer)
member.summary: When an identifier is encountered, it could be a number of things. A single identifer by itself is considered a variable. The pattern identifier[.identifier]+ will consider the first identifier as a variable and the others as properties. Any identifier that is followed by an open parenthesis is considered to be a function call. Indexes are not handled yet, but should be handled in the future. If the identifier is "this" then a this reference is used.

member.summary: A collection of identifiers that should be recognized as types.

member.summary: A collection of identifiers that should be recognized as enums.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Parser.Fields
member.summary: A collection of names of fields.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer
member.summary: Divides the string into tokens.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: A tokenizer is always constructed on a single string. Create one tokenizer per string.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.MoveNext
member.summary: Moves to the next character. If there are no more characters, then the tokenizer is invalid.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.GetNextToken
member.summary: Gets the next token in the string. Reads as many characters as necessary to retrieve that token.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.GetString
member.summary: Anything that starts with a character is considered a string. This could be a primitive quoted string, a primitive expression, or an identifier

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.GetNumber
member.summary: A token that starts with a number can be an integer, a long, or a double.
member.remarks: An integer is the default for numbers. Numbers can also be followed by a l, L, d, or D character to indicate a long or a double value respectively. Any numbers containing a dot (".") are considered doubles.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.GetOperator
member.summary: Some operators take more than one character. Also, the tokenizer is able to categorize the token's priority based on what kind of operator it is.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.Current
member.summary: Allows access to the token most recently parsed.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.IsInvalid
member.summary: Indicates that there are no more characters in the string and tokenizer is finished.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.Providers.DomParser.Tokenizer.IsChar
member.summary: Is the current character a letter or underscore?

member.summary: Is the current character a dot (".")?

member.summary: Is the current character a comma?

member.summary: Is the current character a number?

member.summary: Is the current character a whitespace character?

member.summary: Is the current character an operator?

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.RulesContext.PredicateFunction(System.Object,System.CodeDom.CodeExpression)
member.summary: BaseRuleSetFilterExpressionProvider must interpret all collection expression to string call one of methods ( ValidateAll, ValidateAny, ConditionCollectionCount ) with CodeExpression for one of collection item Example: ConditionCollectionAll(this.CustomerAccount.Addresses, "this.Organization == "Org1" && this.Line1 = "line"") exactly second parameter must be converted to CodeExpression statement by Parser in provider.

member.summary: Rule Expression Validator based on Windows Workflow Foundation Rules Engine.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.RulesExprValidator.Eval(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Evals the specified expression against the context passed in the dictionary.
member.param: The key. Must be a unique key identifying the current expression. It might be used for caching purpose by the engine.
The context, which consists of object that will be accessible during expression evaluation.

member.summary: Deserializes the rule set.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.SimpleExprValidator.Eval(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary:
Validates the xml string and compares it to existing profile. The xml string must have the following format:
<Profile> <propertyCondition name="Profile" required="true|false"> <Parameter name="operator" value="=|!=|contains|doesNotContain"/> <Parameter name="propertyName" value="propertyName"/> <Parameter name="propertyValue" value="propertyValue"/> </propertyCondition> </Profile>
Condition.Name should correspond to the object in the context dictionary with a same name.
member.param: The key. Must be a unique key identifying the current expression. It might be used for caching purpose by the engine.
The expression that needs to be evaluated.
The context, which consists of object that will be accessible during expression evaluation.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Validators.SimpleExprValidator.EvalPropertyCondition(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Evals the property condition.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
